alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 23 at 7:40PM CDT until April 24 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN SHAWNEE AND NORTHERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 739 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Winchester to 3 miles northeast of Williamstown to 4 miles south of Lecompton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Oskaloosa, Eudora, Richland, Perry, McLouth, Lecompton, Clinton, Clinton Lake and Williamstown. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 187 and 205. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
